industry: Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Beverage Manufacturing, and Baked Goods Manufacturing
description:
Employment Type: Full-time

Available Positions: 1

Location: On-Site

Application Deadline: August 29th, 2024

Summary

The Supply Chain Analyst will be responsible for purchasing and sales department and documents data entry & filing for the Import department.


Key Activities


  • Analyze sku’s inventories by warehouse locations and re-balance inventories if needed throughout the warehouse network via over the road transfers.
  • Send over the road transfers request to customer service with all the necessary information required like quantities to be shipped by item and shipping and receiving warehouses.
  • Analyze sku’s sales trends and seasonality to come up with purchasing recommendations from overseas.
  • Recommend repacking sku’s if product is not available from overseas or if product will run out before containers arrive.
  • Communicate to sales, customer service and purchasing the expected timing of incoming product and shortages, if any.
  • Follow up with suppliers on open purchase orders scheduled to be shipped two weeks prior to shipment date to assure on time departures. Delays will be communicated to purchasing and sales so that an alternative plan can be devised.
  • Identifies overstock inventory and communicates to purchasing and sales so a plan can be developed to sell the excess inventory.
  • Daily entry and filing of import documents such as ISF’s, Delivery Orders and Shipping documents.
  • Receive and post inventory in our ERP system as containers are delivered to the multiple warehouses.


Preferred Skills


  • 4-year degree (supply chain preferred).
  • Excellent analytical skills.


Educations & Experience

  • 3-5 years of related work experience.
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel.
